name: Gray
description: Gray styles himself as a character in an old silent film. He takes the act seriously but sometimes forgets to keep his mouth shut when doing finger bullets.

gadgets.name: Walking Cane
gadgets.description: Gray's next hit from Finger Pistol shoots a walking cane which pulls in enemies back by a bit.

gadgets.name: Grand Piano
gadgets.description: Gray's next hit from Finger Pistol will also leave a target on the ground where a piano will land and hurt enemies. It would be too bad if someone got hurt, right?

starpowers.name: Fake Injury
starpowers.description: When Gray has full health, the next damage taken is reduced by 50%.

starpowers.name: New Perspective
starpowers.description: When Gray or his Allies use Doors, they recover 1320 hit points.

tips: Using a Shield Gear on Gray is a good idea in combination with his Fake Injury Star Power, since Gray is always at full health as long as his Gear's shield is up, meaning all hits he takes will stay reduced by 50% until he takes a hit without a shield up.

Be wary when using his Super because Gray can accidentally teleport in front of a high damaging Brawler such as Darryl or Bull. This can be prevented by manually aiming his Super away from close range Brawlers.

In Solo Showdown, you should save your super as a last resort when you need to escape from a tight situation. The Super activation is instant and unlike the regular teleport, enemies can't use the dimensional door.
His attack reload is slow and his bullets are delayed so its best to aim your attacks rather than auto aiming.
In Heist, Gray can put his Super near the enemies' safe, so that teammates can quickly teleport to the safe to do damage and/or quickly escape from defending enemies.

This can be devastating to the enemies' safe when used by teammates such as Buzz and Spike, as they can quickly melt the enemies' safe, and the enemies are pressured to defend both the teleporter and the safe.
By using his Walking Cane Gadget, Gray can finish off low health brawlers hiding behind walls, or can even disarm enemies holding the ball in Brawl Ball.

Teleporting while pulling an enemy with Gray's Walking Cane Gadget can allow the pull range to be extended to Gray's initial position before teleporting, allowing the player to bring high-focus targets like a Gem carrier closer to your team.

While camping near Gray's teleporters is a viable strategy to ambush him or his teammates, do note that if you stand too close to one they will begin to glow similarly to when they are being activated, betraying your location.
